item.title: [HADOOP-15450] Avoid fsync storm triggered by DiskChecker and handle disk full situation
item.description:
Fix disk checker issues reported by kihwal in HADOOP-13738

There are non-hdfs users of DiskChecker, who use it proactively, not just on failures. This was fine before, but now it incurs heavy I/O due to introduction of fsync() in the code.
item.summary: Avoid fsync storm triggered by DiskChecker and handle disk full situation

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Split this out into separate changes. For now this fixes Hadoop Common to avoid doing disk IO unless explicitly requested to address the immediate concern.

Will add the disk full check via HDFS-13538.

Hi arpitagarwal and kihwal,

Thanks for working on this issue.

I'm preparing for 3.0.3 release. Couple of questions:

1. This jira seems an important one, would you please confirm it's a blocker for 3.0.3?

2. If it's a blocker, do we need HDFS-13538 too?

Split this out into separate changes. For now this fixes Hadoop Common to avoid doing disk IO unless explicitly requested to address the immediate concern.
Will add the disk full check via HDFS-13538.

Thanks.

Yes it is a blocker. The performance regression was introduced in HADOOP-13738. For the 2.8.4 release, it was reverted in the release branch. If the 3.0.x release schedule does not allow waiting for this to complete, reverting it in the release branch (i.e. branch-3.0.3) is an option.

kihwal, can you review this patch? I believe it will address your concerns for now. It solves the immediate problem by removing disk IO from the disk check path.

HDFS-13538 is the second part of the change to restore disk IO for HDFS disk checks but also add an exception for disk full. That should not block any releases.
Thanks for addressing the issue, Arpit. I've committed this to trunk, branch-3.1, branch-3.0, branch-2, branch-2.9 and branch-2.8.
